column4: as you seem to know something, can you help me with a mount error
what is the issue
you need to mount an ntfs drive?
what command did you use, and why are you running dapper?
LTS.
Places > (Mount is called VISTA) > get error I showed you.
LTS just means longer support, it does not mean it's better or more stable
LTS = I don't have to upgrade as often...
did you try manually mounting it?
is only if you need a stable system.
doesn't everyone need a stable system???
type mount in a terminal
dapper is like server level OMG IF IT GOES DOWN MY LIFE IS OVER
cause it's not mounted!
where do you want to mount it to
type sudo mount /dev/hdb5 /vista
I knew it wasn't mounted, and I assume it won't show in 'mount' as I don't know FS and so on.
type sudo mount /dev/hdb5 /vista
mount point doesn't exist, can I create it?
did you mean the mount point is /mnt/vista or /mount/vista?
